text: Anyone know how to get the name of the last form submitted?

I'm curious to hear this as well. We're working on a way to fetch more advanced data and "Fetch latest created/updated" is a criteria users will have access to. I imagine it would be simple to grab the latest submitted form at that point, though we're still a ways off before this feature is complete

We have a multiple forms that we “label” specifically so we want to trigger automation based off that name.

In the past we’ve used a hidden field but if our client doesn’t clone the form then that could be missed. We have documentation and everything but trying to keep human error down!

for example: `Offer` is always in the name of the form.

Then we could do a workflow for a sales person to call them within 10 minutes.
anyone here who has created custom workflow actions through apps that is willing to have a quick chat to help me out with something?
For what it’s worth the team is actually working on an update to the webhook action to make this possible. Not sure of the exact timeline but should be coming relatively soon.
So it should be live like... tomorrow? sweet!
Thanks for the info, will keep an eye out for it if we have not finished it with the custom code by then.
<@U03JDEHCX17> I have created CWAs before you can DM me with questions, although this channel is a really good resource as well.

Hi! I don’t know if this is the proper place to post this question, but it might have to do with workflows so here it goes.

 I have a behavioral event (legacy) that comes from Segment called “Coupon Applied”. Inside this event’s JSON, there’s a property called “coupon_id”, which is really the coupon code. The event refers to the moment in which users in my e-commerce apply a certain coupon to their shopping cart. I want to save this “coupon_id” property in the corresponding Contact object. I have created a property in the Contact objects called “Last Coupon Applied” with internal name “coupon_id”, but the field is not getting set with the value coming from the event.

I tried coupling a workflow triggered by the behavioral event, but I couldn’t find the option to set the Contact property with the coupon value coming from the event. Could you help me with this?

:wave:  I work on the product team at HubSpot in charge of making that a better experience.

If you have any feedback on the process of creating custom workflow actions please feel free to DM me!
<@U02EFVAAGCR> I got on a call and figured it out with him.
